results.title: A Farmer's boy
results.brief_description: Film about a farmer’s son who is about to start working on his father’s farm. The boy’s parents suggest that he goes to agricultural college. Shows the work of Seale-Hayne Agricultural College, Devon including students pig feeding, milking, butter making, poultry rearing, ploughing, machine maintenance and sheep shearing.

results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, David O. Selznick, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Selznick Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: A remake of the 1932 classic tale by famed author Ernest Hemmingway. Rock Hudson stars as an American ambulance driver during World War I. Wounded in action, he is restored to health by an army nurse played by Jennifer Jones. However, their love affair is doomed as the war hangs like a spectre over their lives. Shot on location in the Dolomite region of Italy, the film is sentimentally tragic and never quite reaches the heights of the earlier version. Vittorio De Sica is excellent as the cynical Major Rinaldi, while Hudson and Jones make an attractive couple, but their performances are hampered by a cliched script.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Vidor, David O. Selznick, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Selznick Pictures Corporation

results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.brief_description: This is the original Academy Award winning screen version of Hemingway’s well-crafted story of doomed love between Frederic, a wounded ambulance driver (Gary Cooper) and Catherine, his English nurse (Helen Hayes) in Italy in World War I. The war serves merely as a backdrop for their tragic romance. The film is mostly concerned with the fate of Catherine and Frederick - their quick but ardent meeting, their mock wedding in a hospital room, their long and painful separation during which Frederic deserts the army, and Catherine’s death in childbirth. Their farewell scene, where Catherine dies in Frederic’s arms as the bells peal out Armistice, is a moving climax to this all time classic of the screen.

results.title: A Far off world
results.brief_description: A love story set on another planet. A girl finds herself in doubt about a relationship with her friend. She seeks advice from the Master of the Planet. He grants her wish but she finds later that it is not quite what she had in mind.

results.title: A Family talks about sex
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust, E C Brown Foundation and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with situations parents face in giving their children guidance and information about sex. Emphasises that if the parent-child relationship is based on love, respect and trust, then there is reason to hope that the children will make responsible decisions about sex.

results.title: A Family story
results.brief_description: As a small child living in London Daphne witnessed the Blitz. This story is about Daphne’s life growing up in London in WW2 and her migration and settlement in Australia.

results.title: A Family of Tokyo
results.brief_description: A working day and a holiday in the life of a Japanese middle-class family of a husband, wife and three school-age children. Shows the respective status, roles and functions of family members and the ble.ding of the traditional and modern in family life

results.title: A Family moves camp and gathers food (A)
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “People of the Australian western desert (A)”.
Filmed in May 1965 in the Desert Sandhill country of the Western Desert, the film documents a group of Aboriginal families still living their traditional way of life. Shows them moving camp, hunting and gathering.

results.title: A Family affair: conflict
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: An 18 year-old boy leaves home against his parents’ wishes to work in a summer theatre. This aggravates the tense family atmosphere which results from an over-anxious and over-possessive mother and a father who is frustrated and withdrawn into himself. They both agree to seek help from a social case-worker who helps them to continue marriage as responsible adults. When the teenage daughter wishes to go out with someone of whom mother does not approve, father is able to persuade mother that the girl should be allowed to make her own mistakes.
